text: Faristenia ussuriella is a moth in the family Gelechiidae. It is found in the Russian Far East and Korea.Faristenia at funet The wingspan is 14–15 mm. The forewings are greyish brown with a well-developed costal patch and with several dark fuscous streaks near the base, along the antemdial fascia and below the costal patch. The hindwings are pale grey.Insecta koreana 10 : 35 The larvae feed on Quercus mongolica. ==References== Category:Faristenia Category:Moths described in 1991
title: Faristenia ussuriella
